title: Turmeric Fingers
description: Turmeric fingers, the purest form of turmeric, find applications in medicines, food, and dyeing processes. Sourced from organic farmers in Erode, these fingers are then processed into turmeric powder.

title: Garlic
description: A strongly aromatic herb with a bulb of 10 to 20 cloves covered in a papery coat. Sword-shaped leaves and dense clusters of greenish-white or pinkish flowers grow from an underground stem.

title: Maize
description: Maize, a globally dominant crop, is versatile and widely cultivated. Originating in Central America, it's renowned as the queen of cereals due to its exceptional yield potential.

title: Moringa Leaves
description: Moringa leaves are tripinnately compound, dark green, and elliptical to ob-ovate, while the inflorescence consists of spreading campanile structures with fragrant flowers.

title: Black Turmeric
description: Black turmeric, scientifically named Curcuma caesia, is a rare spice with black rhizomes. It is highly prized in traditional medicine for its anti-inflammatory and antioxidant qualities.

title: Dry Alovera
description: Dry Aloe Vera is the dehydrated form of the succulent plant, known for its health and skincare benefits due to its gel-like substance rich in vitamins, minerals, antioxidants, and enzymes.
